citeinfo.origin: Indiana Geological and Water Survey (IGWS) (Data processor)
Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) (Data originator)
citeinfo.title: NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP: Registered Naloxone Dispensing Entities in Indiana (Indiana State Department of Health, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
NOTE: NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP is an Esri point shapefile that was produced from data that were harvested on February 26, 2018 from the "Overdose Prevention Therapy-Indiana Registry" website of the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH). These data should not be considered completely current, as entities could potentially be added or removed from the registry since the last date of publication. Further, entities that temporarily run out of naloxone stock are temporarily removed from the live optIN Registry website, and are reinstated when the ISDH is notified that the entity has been resupplied with dosages. For the most current information about naloxone entities, and other related online resources, please visit the ISDH optIN Registry website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ).
The following is excerpted from the file named "Indiana-Statewide-Naloxone-Standing-Order-Toolkit.pdf" which is hosted online by the ISDH ( https://optin.in.gov/files/Indiana-Statewide-Naloxone-Standing-Order-Toolkit.pdf ):
"Naloxone Entity Defined - "Naloxone Entities" may include pharmacies, pharmacists or other non-pharmacy organizations, non-profit entities or individuals that are in a position to assist an individual who, there is reason to believe, is at risk of experiencing an opioid-related overdose. Naloxone Entities must, at all times, comply with the following criteria and all other conditions enumerated in Indiana Code 16-42-27 et seq.:
"1. Obtain naloxone from a prescriber (physician, physician assistant or advanced practice nurse with authority to prescribe) either by virtue of the attached standing order or other standing order or prescription issued by a prescriber;
"2. Annually register as a "Naloxone Entity" at https://optin.in.gov/ in a manner prescribed by the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH);
"3. Provide education and training on drug overdose response and treatment, including the administration of an overdose intervention drug and the legal requirement to call 9-1-1 immediately before or after administering the drug; and
"4. Provide drug addiction treatment information and referrals to drug treatment programs, including programs in the local area and programs that offer medication assisted treatment that includes a federal Food and Drug Administration approved long acting, non-addictive medication for the treatment of opioid or alcohol dependence."
The ISDH optIN website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ) also states the following:
"The state is committed to saving lives by making naloxone, a drug that reverses the symptoms of opioid overdose, available to first responders, family, friends and others who are likely to be the first on the scene if someone overdoses. Naloxone, also known by the brand name "Narcan," is a non-narcotic medication that is an antidote for opioid overdoses. If administered in a timely manner, naloxone can reverse the life-threatening respiratory failure that is usually the cause of overdose deaths. Naloxone has been proven effective in reversing overdoses caused by heroin and prescription medications such as "OxyContin," "Percocet," "Methadone," and "Vicodin."
"The ISDH has created the Overdose Prevention Therapy-Indiana, or optIN, registry where entities can register as naloxone dispensers. The registry, which can be accessed at www.optin.in.gov, allows nonprofits, pharmacies, local health departments, addiction treatment facilities, correctional facilities and other entities to register as providers of naloxone. Entities must provide training in the use of naloxone, instruct those who administer it to call 911 and provide a list of options for substance abuse treatment. Registered entities must annually report, among other things, the number of naloxone doses distributed to the state."
Visit the following webpage for further information from the ISDH concerning opioid misuse, prevention, and fatal overdoses - ( https://www.in.gov/isdh/27358.htm ).

descript.abstract:
NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP is an Esri point shapefile showing the locations of 705 registered Naloxone Entities in Indiana. These registered entities can dispense naloxone to people without a prescription (no prescription is needed). A person seeking naloxone can ask the entity to use the state health commissioner's "Statewide Standing Order." The Statewide Standing Order, authorized by I.C 16-42-27, is renewed each year. Naloxone Entities must at all times remain compliant with Indiana law to act under the Statewide Standing Order, and abide by the attestations made on the optIN Registry website. All entities are also required to provide training for usage of naloxone, as well as to provide other available addictions resources within Indiana. Attribute information includes entity name, address, contact phone, contact email, and website URLs.
NOTE: NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP should not be considered completely current, as entities could potentially be added or removed from the registry since the last date of publication (20180226). Further, entities that temporarily run out of naloxone stock are temporarily removed from the live optIN Registry website, and are reinstated when the ISDH is notified that the entity has been resupplied with dosages. For the most current information about Naloxone Entities in Indiana, and other related online resources, please visit the ISDH optIN Registry website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ).
descript.purpose: NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP was created to provide a GIS layer that shows the registered Naloxone Entities in Indiana. These registered entities have the ability to provide a person access to dosages of the non-narcotic medication naloxone, as well as to provide training or assistance in usage of naloxone. For the most current information about Naloxone Entities in Indiana, and other related online resources, please visit the ISDH optIN Registry website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ).

cntinfo.cntpos: Director of Health Data, Informatics, and Geographics (HDIG)

idinfo.native: Esri ArcGIS point shapefile format (v 10.5), approximately 500 Kb

attracc.attraccr: All attributes values were harvested from the ISDH optIn Registry website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ) and are assumed to be accurate.

dataqual.complete: This dataset contains all naloxone dispensing entities in Indiana (as of 20180226) that have registered on the ISDH optIn Registry website ( https://optin.in.gov/ ).

horizpa.horizpar: The data were provided by ISDH and assumed to be accurate.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

srcinfo.srccontr: Provides locations of registered naloxone dispensing entities in Indiana as of February 26, 2018.

procstep.procdesc: IGWS personnel harvested the locations of registered naloxone entites in Indiana from the ISDH "Overdose Prevention Therapy-Indiana Registry" (optIN) website, and saved the output as a text file named "optIN_Naloxone_Dispensers_26Feb2018.txt" in GeoJSON format. The GeoJSON file was then converted to an Esri point shapefile using an online conversion tool ( https://mygeodata.cloud/converter/geojson-to-shp ). The resulting shapefile was reprojected to UTM (Zone 16 North) coordinates (NAD83), and saved as "NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP" to conform to naming conventions of the IGWS. The following empty or superfluous attribute fields were then deleted from the attribute table; CNTY, ORG, ADR, GEO, PHYS, HOURS, STATE, and WEBNAME. Also, one entity was removed because the actual location is in Michigan, while five entity locations were manually re-adjusted to more accurate locations (Walgreens #12812, Walgreens #5141, Walgreens #5718, Walgreens #7618, and Walgreens #9359) by visual inspection using aerial imagery and online web search results for store address locations.

After internal review of the data, IGWS personnel added the attribute field named "TypeCorr" to the attribute table so that potential errors in the facility designation attribute field named "EntityType" could be fixed. A total of sixteen (16) records were estimated to have an entity designation that were in error. A better estimate for these 16 entities were based on interpretation of the information provided in the "Name" attribute field. (For example, the entity named "Bloomington Police Department" was originally labeled as "other (99)" but has now been attributed to represent "Corrections/Fire (30)".

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Street address for the entity location
City name where the entity is located
ZIP Code for the address where the entity is located
Telephone number for contact for the entity
Electronic-mail address for contact for the entity
Website URL address for the entity
Coded value for the type of entity

edom.edomvd: Entity is designated as a "501(c) Non-Profit" facility
Entity is designated as a "Addictions Treatment" facility
Entity is designated as a "Corrections" facility
Entity is designated as a "Health Department" facility
Entity is designated as a "Pharmacy" facility
Entity is designated as a "School" facility

attr.attrdef: coded value for the type of entity (IGWS corrected 16 entties designations, based on the facility names)

edom.edomvd: Entity is designated as a "501(c) Non-Profit" facility
Entity is designated as a "Addictions Treatment" facility

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological and Water Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [NALOXONE_PROVIDERS_ISDH_IN.SHP: Registered Naloxone Dispensing Entities in Indiana (Indiana State Department of Health, Point Shapefile), 20180226].
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological and Water Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove Avenue, Bloomington, Indiana 47405 2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological and Water Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGWS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGWS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGWS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
